title: Brie Larson was 'nervous' to meet Bachelor star Nick Viall
title_page: Brie Larson was 'nervous' to meet Bachelor star Nick Viall | Daily Mail Online
text:
She's won an Academy Award for Best Actress.
But that doesn't mean Brie Larson is immune to celebrity, as she revealed on Wednesday's episode of Jimmy Kimmel Live.
The 27-year-old Room star began by explaining how she puts on a regular viewing party for the hit ABC reality show.
Scroll down for video
Honest: Brie Larson revealed on Wednesday's episode of Jimmy Kimmel Live that she was star-struck when Bachelor star Nick Viall stopped by her viewing party
'We have a red wine fountain, which is very classy,' she revealed, while also sharing with Jimmy the 'bingo' card her and her friends use as the show is airing.
She then told the story of how this season's star, Nick Viall, showed up at one of her parties.
'So I guess the party had become infamous at this point,' she admitted, before recounting how 'a friend of a friend found out about it and [Viall] showed up at one of our gatherings a couple of weeks ago.'
Though the star has mingled with some of Hollywood's most elite personalities, apparently the hunky Nick still made quite an impact.
Sociable: The 27-year-old Room star began by explaining how she puts on a regular viewing party for the hit ABC reality show
Game night: 'We have a red wine fountain, which is very classy,' she revealed, while also sharing with Jimmy the 'bingo' card her and her friends use as the show is airing
'I was too shy. I got freaked out and star-stuck. The day before, I was like hugging Meryl Streep and I was like, ‘This is fine,’ but then Nick showed up at my house.'
The Kong: Skull Island actress then told the late night host what actually transpired after the initial shock.
'He was really cool about it but we were all really nervous,' she confessed.
Heartthrob: Though the star has mingled with some of Hollywood's most elite personalities, apparently the hunky Nick still made quite an impact
Incognito? Brie also took the opportunity to surreptitiously take several photos of the reality television vet
'He came with his best friends so we thought it was going to be fine. We always gather an hour before the show starts so we can catch up, drink some red wine. [Viall] came for that part and I figured he would just leave afterwards. After an hour he just stayed.'
Brie also took the opportunity to surreptitiously take several photos of the reality television vet.
On the plus side, it seems he was a very gracious guest, as 'he didn't give any spoilers' and 'had such a good sense of humor' about the whole experience.
And while she's still engaged to musician Alex Greenwald, it appears the young actress managed to enjoy a little flirting, as she gushed 'I can't believe this just happened, Nick thinks I'm okay!'
